messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] TV Shows
messages.msgSnippet: ... == I thought that unschooling meant there was no curriculum. Just a thought. PBS has a few okay shows for kids. Don t know how educational they are,
messages.messageBody:
At 12:06 PM 9/23/02 -0700, you wrote:

>I am going to be unschooling my four yo daughter in
>August 2003 and am looking for some good educational
>T.V. programs to include in her curriculum.
==
I thought that unschooling meant there was no curriculum. Just a thought.
PBS has a few "okay" shows for kids. Don't know how "educational" they are,
but our kids (7 & 9/10) like them.

Todd

"If you choose not to decide, you still have made a choice.
I will choose Free Will" -Rush (& Todd)
http://rambleman.tripod.com/index.html

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] TV Shows
messages.msgSnippet: Hi Shannon, Does your daughter attend some kind of school now?  If not, then you are already unschooling her.  What TV shows does she enjoy now?  Watch those
messages.messageBody:
Hi Shannon,
Does your daughter attend some kind of school now? If not, then you are
already unschooling her. What TV shows does she enjoy now? Watch those
with her and see if you can find shows/videos that are about things she has
shown interest in. Also look for stuff about your interests "Field trips"
are a school-term, along with educational vs. junk TV, videos, books,etc.
and curriculum. When you go places now with your daughter, what do you call
it then? Going to the zoo, playground, park,etc. Just keep calling it that
and save the school-terms for any reports you have to give to the school
district.
As for places to go, take her places she likes and that you think she might
like. Active/ hands-on is much better than don't touch places.
Have you been to unschooling.com? The message boards are wonderful.

Mary-NY (mom to 3 dd-12,9,4 and to 2ds-7,2)

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] TV Shows
messages.msgSnippet: Hi, Shannon -- Here s an extensive list of California field trip ideas, put together by the  Homeschooling Association of California.
messages.messageBody:
Hi, Shannon --

Here's an extensive list of California field trip ideas, put together by
the Homeschooling Association of California.

http://www.hsc.org/fieldtrips/FieldTripDirIntro.html

(For those who don't live in CA, the HSC site also has a great list of
educational websites.)

Betsy

are some good places for field trips?
Thank you

shannon, of California**
